column4: hi all, the 'more' command doesn't work, it stops after displaying a single page, it doesn't ask for --More-- , how can i solve?
also, try hitting space to see if it scrolls in spite of the missing message
less works, but it doesnt fix 'more'
thanks for you answers, but it returns to the prompt after showing a page
just displays a page and then the bash prmpt
what happens when you do 'ls -R / | less'?
listen to thoreauputic -- set it to less, preferrably
yeah, i know less is better but it doesnt fix 'more', ill promise to use less from now on, but i just wanna now what happens to 'more'
I suppose it's just there for compatibility
strace? can you tell me more about that?
thanks, i'll try it as soon as i get access to the machine
also, check the output from " ls -l $(which more)". Here it's -rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 32256 2006-10-12 16:47 /bin/more (and my "more" works as expected)
also i have to tell that i tried to replace more with another bin/more from otrher server
more uses (ldd more) libncurses and other basic libs
to revert to the ubuntu version, run 'sudo apt-get --reinstall install util-linux'
